fields.description: Fix TestPrivilegedOperationExecutor.testExecutorPath on Windows because of the path format.

comments.body:
Before the patch:

!image-2018-05-18-14-42-56-314.png!

After the patch:

!image-2018-05-18-14-43-09-321.png!

I think we should use some of the path utilities to generate the path.
That should take care of the proper slashes.
[~surmountian], you've been fixing these kind of tests, any pointers?
How about using org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path#SEPARATOR instead of '/' or '\' ?

Thanks [~elgoiri] and [~surmountian] .

public static final String SEPARATOR = "/" is not enough for our case.

Take a look at Path#normalizePath, it pretty much takes care of these things.
We should do something similar to that.
Thanks [~elgoiri] for the suggestion. Posted v2.

Actually, does it make sense to run a test that has linux in the name on Windows at all?
We may want to just assume Windows like proposed in YARN-8359.

You did bring a good point here. All the tests in that package (linux/privileged) seem to run successfully in Windows except this test that is being fixed by this patch. YARN-8359 is for the package (linux/runtime) where the tests actually are failing in Windows for proper security reasons.

We need to figure it out if this test has to run in Windows or not.

I'm fine either way. The options are:
# Skipping the full test as it's not supposed to be done in Windows.
# Making it pass on Windows.

Probably the second one would help maintain the code.
[^YARN-8324.v2.patch] achieves this so we can go with that.
Just make sure this passes on Windows.

Other than the checkstyle, this looks good.
+1 for [^YARN-8324.v2.patch], please also solve the minor checkstyle issue.
If without the checkstyle issue, +1 on  [^YARN-8324.v2.patch].
Let's hold on this one as YARN-8359 may disable the whole test set for Windows.
